msg: Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
-The manifests for framework and flex4 will now be maintained from the frameworks/halo-manifest.xml and frameworks/spark-manifest.xml instead of maintaining duplicate copies.
-added lookupOnly="true" for classes that refer to other swcs
-mxml-manifest.xml is removed from SVN but is now copied (during the build) from halo-manifest.xml and will still remain in the frameworks directory just not under src.
-renamed the airframework manifest files to be more air specific
-removed bundles.properties as they should not be checked in because they are created during the build.xml
-update flex/flex4/.project to have the spark-manifest link to point at frameworks/spark-manifest.xml
qa: yes. there may be an issue using the flash.filters when using multiple namespaces
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

Add hack to Grammar.jj to allow special component tags in spark and halo namespaces to resolve to special node in the parser. This will be re-addressed once we stabilize on the renames and can better enforce the contents of MXML 2006, MXML 2009, FXG, Spark and Halo.

Add a work around for the step building the AIR Updater UI to set -compatibility-version=3.0.0. This involved checking in a local copy to override the sample-frameworks-build.xml checked into the AIR Integration Kit.zip.
Adding missing base halo and spark classes that appear as qualified type selectors in our defaults.css files but have historically not been in our manifests for MXML tag mappings.
QE: This should help pass more tests.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
1st pass of rename according to the spec http://opensource.adobe.com/wiki/display/flexsdk/Dropping+the+Fx+Prefix

Flex now requires CSS Style declarations to declare @namespace rules and disambiguate between halo and spark components using CSS 3 namespace prefixes on type selectors. At compile time, this namespace information will be used to map type names to qualified ActionScript class names. At runtime, type selectors are matched on qualified ActionScript class name (for example mx.controls.Button rather than just Button). Flex 3 applications must be compiled with -compatibility-version=3.0.0 to get unqualified CSS type selector behavior.
QE: Yes, this build may help in updating test cases to use the new namespaces and class names.
